page.title: 09ECOLOGY C. CROOKHAM
page.content: In the southern and eastern part of the study block lies a large area of lowland heath.Much of this belongs to the Ministry of Defence and is used for troop training but it contains one Site of Special Scientific Interest around the area of Ceasar's Camp. Although there has been quite a growth of invasive vegetation,such as Silver Birch and Scots Pine,there are still quite sizeable areas of open heathland. The three main types of heather;ling,bell and cross-leaved, are in abundance and gorse is a very common feature.Insects commonly recorded range from dragonflies and wolf and crab spiders to Emperor Moths and Silver Studded Blue Butterflies. The rarer heathland birds,such as Hobby,Dartford Warbler and Nightjar, all nest in the area and adders and common lizards are widespead.
